summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services clinical encounter record for Jeffrey Epstein, documenting an injury assessment following an incident in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM) on July 23, 2019. The report details marks on his neck consistent with a rope, notes he was placed on suicide watch, and records his statement that he did not know how the injury occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical encounter, found in his cell with a rope around his neck, assessed for injuries and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The Mid-Level Practitioner (MLP) who conducted the clinical examination, documented Epstein's vital signs, physical findings, and his statements.

persons.name: Operational Lt.
persons.context: The operational lieutenant who requested the injury report for inmate Epstein.

connections.description: MLP conducted the medical assessment and examination of Epstein following the cell incident.
The Operational Lieutenant requested the injury report for Epstein, indicating custodial oversight.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell in the Special Housing Unit with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was subsequently assessed by medical staff and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical Injury Assessment
events.description: A clinical encounter was performed at the prison health services unit to assess injuries Epstein sustained. The exam noted a circular line of erythema (redness) around his neck and a small mark on his knee.

locations: Special Housing Unit Z05, Cell 124 L
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell (Special Housing Unit Z05-Cell 124 L) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor.

Epstein told the medical provider (MLP) he did not know how the injury happened, stating 'I do not know. Just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting.' He declined to discuss the events leading to the marks.

The medical assessment documented a 'circular line of erythema at the base of the neck' approximately 2 inches wide, covering two-thirds of the neck circumference, with signs of friction in the front.
Despite the injury, Epstein was described as ambulatory, alert, oriented, smiling during the exam, and denying any pain, discomfort, or respiratory problems.
Epstein was immediately placed on suicide watch following the incident, and a follow-up with psychology services was planned.
